## writing my first function

as an example, here's a z-score computation
```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(25, mean = 10, sd = 3.5)

(x_vec - mean(x_vec)) / sd(x_vec)
```

Now i'll write a function to do this
```{r}
z_score = function(x){
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  return(z)
}

z_score(x = x_vec)
```
does this always work?
```{r, error=TRUE}
z_score(x = 3)
```

```{r,error=TRUE}
z_score(x=c("my","name","is","jeff"))
```

需要加上条件
```{r}
z_score = function(x){
  if(!is.numeric(x)){
    stop("x needs to be numeric")
  }
  
  if(length(x) < 5){
    stop("you need at least 5 numbers to compute z score")
  }
  
 z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
 
 return(z)
}
```

```{r, error=TRUE}
z_score(x = 3)
```

```{r, error=TRUE}
z_score(x=c("my","name","is","jeff"))
```

## A new function

```{r}
mean_and_sd = function(x){
  
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)
  
  out_df = 
    tibble(
      mean = mean_x,
      sd = sd_x
    )
  
  return(out_df)
  
}
```

```{r}
mean_and_sd(x_vec)
```

## Check stuff using a simulation
```{r}
sim_df = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(30, 10, 5)
  )

sim_df |>
  summarize(
    mean = mean(x), 
    sd = sd(x)
  )
```

### create a simulation fuction to check mean and sd
```{r}
sim_mean_sd = function(sample_size, true_mean = 10, true_sd = 5){
  sim_df = 
    tibble(
      x = rnorm(sample_size, true_mean, true_sd))
  
  out_df = sim_df |>
    summarize(
      mean = mean(x), 
      sd = sd(x))
  
  return(out_df)
}
```

```{r}
sim_mean_sd(sample_size = 30, true_mean = 4, true_sd = 12)
```

```{r}
sim_mean_sd(sample_size = 30, true_mean = 4, true_sd = 12)
```

```{r}
sim_mean_sd(30, 16, 2)
```

```{r}
sim_mean_sd(330)
```
